uk.ac.uea.activityprogram.Controllers

Class AppDBHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • SQLiteOpenHelper
      • uk.ac.uea.framework.implementation.DatabaseHandler
        • uk.ac.uea.activityprogram.Controllers.AppDBHandler

  • public class AppDBHandler
extends DatabaseHandler
    This extends the framework DatabaseHandler class to create a database for this application and allow manipulation and creation of new tables specific to this application. This class implements the Singleton design patterns to ensure that only one instance of the database is created throughout the application.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static AppDBHandler getInstance(Context context)
        Used by other classes to retreive the Singleton instance of the AppDBHandler class. If the instance is null, it creates a new instance by using the constructor. Else the existing instance is returned.
        Parameters:
        context - the activity Context object
        Returns:
        a Singleton AppDBHandler instance

      • createNewTables

        public void createNewTables(java.lang.String tablename)
        This table is called when the first instance of AppDBHandler is called to create the remainder of the tables that are required for the application. It uses the tablename passed in to determine which table to create. This can be extended to include more tables.
        Parameters:
        tablename - name of the table to be created.

      • getSettings

        public Settings getSettings(java.lang.String actprogram,
                            java.lang.String useremail)
        Retrieves a single Setting from the database based on its primary key - ActivityProgram.
        Parameters:
        actprogram - activity program which is the primary key of the settings table.
        Returns:
        a Settings object, containing the information of the retrieved setting.

      • getAllSettings

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllSettings()
        Retreives the whole of the Settings table from the database. Places each attribute of the table in a string where each attribute is separated by a hashtag. Used for debugging and checking the contents of the table.
        Returns:
        a list of Strings, where each string represents a row in the table with each attribute separated by a hashtag.
